sentence.Network_en: The noise of bombs and guns was incessant.
We have had incessant snowfall since yesterday afternoon.
sentence.Network_cn: 从昨天下午开始就持续不断地下雪.

sentence.Network_en: From the very first days of the reforms, the parliament kept up an incessant drumbeat of protest.
sentence.Network_cn: 从改革的第一天起，议会就不断施压予以抗议。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin incessant-, from in- 'not' + Latin cessant- 'ceasing' (from the verb cessare)

entry.tran: 不停的;连续的;持续不断的
entry.def: An incessant process or activity is one that continues without stopping.

means.word_mean: 1. occurring so frequently as to seem ceaseless or uninterrupted;
2. uninterrupted in time and indefinitely long continuing;

sentences.sentence: "night and day we live with the incessant noise of the city"
"the perpetual struggle to maintain standards in a democracy"
"man's unceasing warfare with drought and isolation"
